keywords.value: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Letters written long ago by Barack Obama Sr. shed new light on a young Kenyan whose ambitions helped change the course of U.S. history. But for the president, they may also revive old pain.

headline.print_headline: Words From Obama’s Father, Waiting to Be Read by His Son
headline.main: Words of Obama’s Father Still Waiting to Be Read by His Son

snippet: Letters written long ago by Barack Obama Sr. shed new light on a young Kenyan whose ambitions helped change the course of U.S. history. But for the president, they may also revive old pain.
abstract: Letters written by Barack Hussein Obama Sr, which were discovered in files at Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, offer insight into young Kenyan who fathered United States' first black president, but may also revive old pain; trove of documents, which span period from 1958 to 1964, highlight  how little Obama Sr was involved in Pres Obama's life.
